intro: Gomphia scheffleri subsp. taitensis, commonly known as the Taiti sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in coastal dunes and sandy soils. The plant produces small, white to pale blue flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, and it is well adapted to withstand salt spray and strong winds. This subspecies is part of the Boraginaceae family and is notable for its ecological importance in stabilizing coastal ecosystems.
